column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=custom.Span|label
#T_RL=custom.Relation|label|BT_custom.Span
#Text=The offensiveness of the several processes described varies from none
#Text=at all to that which constitutes one of the most intolerable of nuisances.
#Text=On different occasions the interference or assistance of the Local
#Text=Government Board have been solicited for the suppression of nuisances
#Text=from works of this character.
#Text=The most notable instances of applications of this kind of late years have been in respect of nuisances from
#Text=manure works along the shores of the Thames in 1873, and in respect
#Text=of similar nuisances at Plymouth in 1875.
#Text=I reported to the Board fully
#Text=upon the former of these cases in December 1873, but more briefly
#Text=upon the latter of them, since at that time the present general inquiry
#Text=had been set on foot.
#Text=It is difficult to describe odours except by the use
#Text=of similitudes.
#Text=The offensive odour proceeding from superphosphate
#Text=works, from works in which animal matters are used more or less freely,
#Text=and from “ scutch ’’ manure works is, however, so distinctive that once
#Text=smelt it can never afterwards fail to be recognised.
#Text=That from superphosphate making is pungent and slightly acid ; by some persons it is
#Text=called sickening, but its offensiveness and sickening quality are enhanced
#Text=where such animal matters as blood, offal, or fish, especially if putrid,
#Text=are employed in the manufacture of the manure.
#Text=I know of no odour
#Text=more horribly sickening than that which is evolved when sulphuric acid
#Text=is mixed with human excrement.
#Text=One of the most offensive works of
#Text=this kind that has come within my observation, where animal matter of
#Text=various kinds, and sometimes excrement, are used, is Bradb urn’s establishment at Wednesfield, upon which I reported to the Board in my
#Text=report on the sanitary condition of that place in 1874.
#Text=The smell
#Text=proceeding from scutch manure works is described by some persons as
#Text=putrid as well as sickening.
#Text=Dr.
#Text=Gordon, the principal medical officer
#Text=of the Woolwich garrison, described to me the odour proceeding from
#Text=the scutch manure works on Erith marshes as resembling, more than
#Text=anything else, that which he had perceived in India when passing to
#Text=leeward of the places in which the Hindoos burn their dead.
#Text=To myself
#Text=the odour resembles that of very decayed and putrid cheese.
#Text=The odour
#Text=from superphosphate works has to my senses something of the same
#Text=character, especially marked when animal matters are used in addition
#Text=to bones and phosphates.
#Text=The distance to which the offensive odour
#Text=may spread beyond the works varies with the various circumstances
#Text=mentioned in the first part of this Report.
#Text=It may be only perceived
#Text=offensively within a radius of 100 yards or less around the works, or the
#Text=odour may extend a mile or more beyond them.
#Text=For example, the
#Text=odour from the Avorks of Morris and Griffin at Wolverhampton is said to
#Text=be perceived offensively at Newbridge, a distance of 1 miles ; Avhile
#Text=that from the Erith marshes “ scutch ” manure works was, on the occasion
#Text=of my inquiry on the Thames, saic) to be an intolerable nuisance at the
#Text=Woolwich barracks, a distance 4 miles.
#Text=Loud and grievous complaints
#Text=are made in the tOAvn of Plymouth, especially by persons residing about
#Text=the Hoe, of the offensive odours from the manure works at Cattedown,
#Text=a distance of about 1 mile, when the wind blows from that direction
#Text=across the bay.
#Text=I have made such inquiries as were practicable as to the effect of
#Text=these offensive odours upon the health of persons exposed to them.
#Text=Replies to individual inquiries have been to the effect that prolonged
#Text=exposure to the offensive odours produces feelings of depression, headache, indisposition for food, nausea, or even sometimes fainting.
#Text=These,
#Text=however, are ordinary results in sensitive individuals of the impression
#Text=made by any specially offensive odour upon the nervous system.
#Text=They
#Text=pass off, however, with the intermission of their cause.
#Text=I have not
#Text=been able to ascertain that any permanent injury to health has followed
#Text=even the frequent repetition of exposure to these offensive odours.
#Text=Nevertheless, so long as the cause operates it does to a serious extent
#Text=sometimes disturb the health of some individuals.
